body_html:
No you can not parse caffe LMDB with tf.LMDBReader.
In fact, using caffe's lmdb file is a bad idea because how inefficient it is: it stores image as arrays instead of jpegs, and can make data loading sometimes many times slower
body_text:
No you can not parse caffe LMDB with tf.LMDBReader.
In fact, using caffe's lmdb file is a bad idea because how inefficient it is: it stores image as arrays instead of jpegs, and can make data loading sometimes many times slower
body:
No you can not parse caffe LMDB with `tf.LMDBReader`.
In fact, using caffe's lmdb file is a bad idea because how inefficient it is: it stores image as arrays instead of jpegs, and can make data loading sometimes [many times slower](https://github.com/tensorpack/tensorpack/issues/124#issuecomment-277206505)
